title: Strictly’s Karim Zeroual tops the leaderboard after bouncing back from the flu
text:
Karim Zeroual has matched the best score on Strictly (Picture: BBC)

Karim Zeroual managed to triumph over Kelvin Fletcher’s hips to land at the top of the leaderboard on Strictly Come Dancing.

The 25-year-old CBBC presenter had to pull out of an appearance on spin-off show It Takes Two earlier this week after coming down with the flu.

It seems it didn’t have any negative effect on his performance with partner Amy Dowden this week, matching the highest score of the series so far with 38, previously won by Kelvin Fletcher last week.

The pair performed a stunning Tango to George Ezra’s Paradise, which earned a sweep of positive comments from the judges.

Speaking after the dance, Craig Revel Horwood said: ‘Well I think it’s the first time we’re really seeing a male celebrity lead and it is incredible.’

‘The best dance of the evening,’ Motsi Mabuse said. ‘End of story.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Their dance managed to top Kelvin Fletcher’s Rumba earlier in the show, which slightly broke the judges who couldn’t quite get over his sensual moves.

It was also an impressive turnaround for Mike Bushell and Katya Jones, who earned their highest score ever of 32 for their Quickstep to Come On Eileen.

Strictly week 4 leaderboard Karim & Amy – 38 points Kelvin & Oti – 36 points Emma & Anton – 35 points Saffron & AJ – 33 points Mike & Katya – 32 points Michelle & Giovanni – 31 points Catherina & Johannes – 30 points David & Nadiya – 28 points Emma & Aljaz – 28 points Dev & Dianne – 27 points Chris & Karen – 26 points Will & Janette – 24 points Alex & Neil – 23 points

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Sunday BBC One.

description: Karim Zeroual hit the top of the leaderboard on Strictly Come Dancing.
